title: Tottenham Women vs . Leicester : FA Women Cup semifinal open thread and how to watch
body_text:
Forget about yesterday, Tottenham Hotspur Women still have something major to play for this season — the FA Women’s Cup. Spurs Women are in the semifinals for the first time in their history, and have an excellent chance, if they play well, of making it to their first ever top level final as they host Leicester City today. The match will be played at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.
Tottenham Women vs. Leicester: FA Women’s Cup semifinal open thread and how to watch
Spurs will try and make their first ever FA Cup final by hosting Leicester at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.
Robert Vilahamn has Spurs Women playing improved football in his first season at the helm, and Spurs will be hoping that their stars — Bethany England, Grace Clinton, Martha Thomas, Jessica Naz, Celin Bizet — can fire them into contention for something truly special. Should they win today, they’ll face the winner of the other semifinalist match between Manchester United and Chelsea.
I know we’re all still smarting from yesterday’s men’s team loss to Newcastle. Put that aside for now, put your colors on, and let’s cheer for the Women in what is a historic match.
COYS!
FA Women’s Cup Semifinal
Tottenham Hotspur Women vs. Leicester City Women
Sunday, April 14, 2024
7:00 a.m. ET / 12:00 p.m. BST
Tottenham Hotspur Stadium, North London, UK
TV: not televised (USA), BBC 2 (UK)
Stream: ESPN+ (USA)
Find your local viewing options at livesoccertv.com
Lineups
Match thread rules
The match thread rules are the same as always. To any visitors coming here for the first time, welcome! We’re glad you’re here! Wipe your feet, mind the gap, and be sure to check out the other pages at this outstanding site. While you’re here, though, we have a few rules and regulations:
- Absolutely no links to illegal streams. They’re bad and they get us in trouble. Violators will be warned or banned.
- We have rules against “relentless negativity.” Nobody likes a Negative Nancy. Don’t knee-jerk and post outlandish or hurtful things just because you’re frustrated.
- Along those lines, outright abuse of players or match officials is also not allowed. It’s fine to say “wow, that was a really bad call,” but it’s NOT okay to direct copious amounts of abuse in the direction of said official over a call you did not like.
- Treat other people in the match thread the way you would want someone else to treat your grandmother. Be nice. This is a community of fans, not an un-moderated message board.
- NO SPIDERS!
- Finally, while we don’t have a rule against profanity, please try and keep the naughty words in check. Also, language that is sexist, racist, transphobic, or homophobic in nature will be swiftly deleted and you will be immediately banned. This is an open, supportive community.
Have fun, and COYS!
